How can I set up solo mining and dual mining on Verus, and what are the benefits of doing so?

Setting up solo mining and dual mining on Verus can be a great way to secure the network and earn rewards in the form of Verus coins (VRSC).

**Solo Mining:**
Solo mining involves setting up a full node of the Verus blockchain on your computer and mining blocks independently. To set up solo mining, you'll need to follow a guide to set up Verus Agama, which will sync up the Verus blockchain and allow you to start mining. Once you've set up solo mining, you'll be eligible to earn the full block reward of 24 coins for each block you mine. Note that solo mining can be less predictable than pool mining, and you may not find a block for a while, but the rewards can be more substantial.

**Dual Mining:**
Dual mining involves using your CPU to mine both solo and on a pool simultaneously. To set up dual mining, you'll need to "split" your CPU thread power between the two. For example, if your CPU has 8 threads, you can assign 4 threads to pool mining and 4 threads to solo mining. This allows you to earn a steady stream of VRSC from pool mining while also having the opportunity to earn a larger reward of 24 coins from solo mining. To set up dual mining, follow the guides for setting up solo mining and pool mining, and assign the threads as desired.

**Mining with CPU and GPU:**
If you have a modern and capable CPU and GPU (currently, this means an Nvidia GPU), you can mine using both hardware types simultaneously. You can split up your CPU power however you like, assigning it to pool mining, solo mining, or both. You can then use the CCMiner available from the Verus Discord community to loop your GPU into the mining process. This allows you to utilize both your CPU and GPU to mine Verus coins.

Additionally, if you have a capable CPU and GPU, you can use both to mine Verus coins simultaneously.
